summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) prosecutors discussing sending a 'friendly subpoena' to an attorney to obtain a copy of a settlement agreement between a victim and Jeffrey Epstein. The agreement is sought for the ongoing investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell's participation in abuse.

persons.name: Audrey
persons.context: A prosecutor at the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) whose approval is required before sending the subpoena to the attorney.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The target of the ongoing investigation into her participation in the abuse of victims, for which the settlement agreement is being sought as evidence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier who was the defendant in a 2009 civil suit, which was resolved by the settlement agreement being sought.

connections.description: The email states the settlement agreement is relevant to the investigation into Maxwell's participation in the abuse of victims, implying their alleged joint criminal activity.

events.title: Civil suit against Epstein
events.description: A civil lawsuit was filed against Jeffrey Epstein by a victim, which was later resolved via a settlement agreement.

events.title: Discussion of 'friendly subpoena'
events.description: Prosecutors in the SDNY discuss sending a subpoena to an attorney to obtain the Epstein settlement agreement for the Maxwell investigation.

keyFacts: Prosecutors sought a 'friendly subpoena' to compel an attorney to provide a copy of a confidential settlement agreement between a victim and Jeffrey Epstein from a 2009 civil case.
The attorney was willing to provide the agreement but believed he needed a subpoena to do so, having already voluntarily provided other case documents.
The settlement agreement was considered relevant evidence for the ongoing investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell's participation in the abuse of victims.
The email chain shows internal procedural discussions among prosecutors, including the need for approval from a supervisor named Audrey.
The document references ongoing litigation over a 'BSF subpoena', indicating other parallel legal processes.
